page.title: 19Colleges for Teachers
page.content: SOUTHLANDS COLLEGE (Roehampton Institute of Education) provides courses leading to B.A.,B.Sc.and B.Ed. for future teachers. It stands on Wimbledon Parkside facing the broad acres of Wimbledon Common. It consists of buildings in various styles from 1860-1970, set in beautiful grounds. Halls of residence accomodate 400 students. It is a Methodist college but elcomes people of all beliefs. Daily worship is shared by all in the hall or chapel. A wide range of social service is undertaken including helping deprived children and both Catholic and Protestant children from Belfast. GIPSY HILL COLLEGE part of (Kingston Polytechnic), provides similar courses plus Business Studies and Management Courses. Several buildings old and new housing a library,gym., lecture rooms are set in grounds on Kingston Hill.
